resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

resource.url: story_content/external_files/Cash Handling Policies and Procedures Template.docx
resource.title: Cash Handling Policies and Procedures Template
UCOP Bus-49 Policy for Cash and Cash Equivalents Received

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
Welcome to the CASHNet Departmental Deposits Training module.
In this course, we will cover the topics displayed on this screen.
Please note that you can jump to a specific section of this module by clicking on the menu link at the top left of the screen to open then menu, and then selecting the slide you would like to view.
At times during this training,we will ask you to click the 'next' button on the player to proceed.
We have added files relevant to this training under the Resources link.
This module is approximately 15 minutes long.
Click next when you are ready to get started.

Before you may begin using CASHNet, you will need to have completed the “Cash Handling Training” module, which takes 30 minutes to complete and is available through the U C Learning Center or by clicking the image on this screen.

This module is required for all personnel who will be handling cash or cash equivalents. For more information visit the Cashier and Payment Solutions website.

Click next to continue.

Your department will need to have cash handling procedures in place and will be required by all staff to carefully read and confirm they have done so by signing a training log.

Copies of these forms will need to be sent via e-mail to the CASHNet Administrator in order for system access to be granted.

If your department does not have any polices or procedures in place here are templates for your department to fill out, edit, and complete. The training log should be used to record staff who has read and understood the cash handling policies and procedures and taken the online training

You can download these templates. Templates are also available on the resources section.

Once the requirements have been met your CASHNet operator access will be ready to be created, and you will be ready to start this training.

Click next to continue.

In order to get your Operator ID, you will need to send an email to cashnet cashiering at u c davis dot e d u with the folowing information:

The Department Name


Your First and Last Name


Your Kerberos ID


and your E-Mail Address


If you are requesting access for more than one person within your department, please complete the “CASHNet Operator List” form. You can download the form by clicking on this button, or from the Resources link.


Click next to continue.

To login to the CASHNet application, click the link provided on the screen, or type in cashiering dot u c davis dot e d u

A browser window will open.

Bookmark the application page for future reference.

Click next to continue.

Log-in to CASHNet via the Central Authentication Service, CAS, by entering your user name and passphrase.

This action will trigger your Duo authentication system to open.

Use your preferred method to authenticate your login. In this case, the user receives a duo notification on their phone, and authorize the session by tapping on the approve button.

Whatever your method is for recording payments, POS or manual receipts, you will need to complete a deposit of collections in CASHNet. The deposit document will accompany the funds for processing at the Hospital Cashier’s Office or Campus Cashier’s Office.

If cash handling activities in your department are infrequent and you would prefer to delegate this authority to the Cashier’s Office, please contact the CASHNet administrator at: cashnetcashiering@ucdavis.edu
If the deposit only contains checks it can still be sent to Campus Cashier’s Office via inner office mail.
Deposits containing cash must be delivered to Hospital or Campus Cashier and Payment Solutions Office in dual custody.
Funds received must first be reconciled according to individual department procedures.

After you login to CASHNet, you will land on the homepage.

Click the Departmental Deposits tab to initiate a deposit.

Let's stop here for a moment and take a look at this screen. At the top of the screen for all departmental deposit operators, the department code will automatically populate to the department you have been assigned to. If you are assigned to more than one department, from the drop-down menu select the department you will be making a deposit for.
The View Open Deposits checkbox is checked by default.
the 'Cashiered Deposits from checkbox',

and the Check the "View voided deposits from" checkbox.

We will cover these options later on this training.
Now that we are familiar with this screen, let's add a record by clicking the "Add new record" button.
Enter an item code in the “Item Code Text Field” or select an “Easy Key” if one has been set up for your department by clicking the binocular icon and selecting an item code from this pop-up box.

Alternatively, you can use these buttons to populate the item code field.

Easy keys are set up with pre-populated G/L accounts.
The “Misc” easy key allows manual entry of a G/L Account.
In this example, we are selecting the STATE easy key.
The “Tab” button on your keyboard allows you navigate from text field to text field.
The bottom section of this window is designated for cash count.

Let's complete a deposit.

We need to compete the required fields. These fields allow letters: A-Z, numbers: 0-9, in addition to hyphen, underscore, and space. All other special characters cannot be used.

The Org ref id field: information entered here will extract to the Reference number column of the General Ledger. It can be used to reference a check number, invoice number, reference code. It allows up to 8 characters.

The line desc field: the information entered in this field will extract to the "Description" column of the general ledger. It can be used to reference what the payment is for or who is making this payment, etc. It allows up to 40 characters. In this example, we will enter the Payee information.

The reference field, here you may enter any additional information. This information will not extract to the general ledger. It allows up to 50 characters.

The chart, account ad object have been pre-populated.

Finally, enter the deposit amount on both of these fields.

Click the Add Item button when you are ready.

If you do not see an easy key with your desired GL Account Number select “MISC.”

This is an empty record, which allows you to enter a specific G/L Account. “MISC” can also be used for over or short entries.

You can download a PDF with the business rules for GL validation here. This document contains a list of allowable gl entries and restrictions when using the miscellaneous easy key.

The PDF is also available under the Resources section of this module.

Click next to continue.

Here you can enter the chart, account and object code, as well as complete the other fields just like we’ve done on the slide before.

Click the add item button.
Once you have created each line item you may go back to make edits or delete a record by either clicking on the “Edit” or “Delete” button.

Enter the payment amount in either the cash detail screen, to the left, or the check amount box, to the right.

Click “Save” to complete.

A pop-up screen will display confirming your deposit successfully saved.

Click OK.

Now you need to print the report to go with your deposit to the Cashier’s Office for processing.

Please note that edits can be made to an already saved deposit by clicking on the "select" button where you will be able to make any necessary adjustments. This change eliminates the requirement of requesting cancellation of deposit documents.

Remember to print the new report to include with your deposit to reflect any changes that were made"

Click the Print button.

A window will open displaying the “CASHNet Deposit Report”.

This document is required to be included with your deposit.

At the bottom of the page the operator who created the deposit will be required to print full name, date, sign, and provide a phone number. This area is not formatted for you to enter this information, departments are required to enter this information manually. Here is a suggested layout.

NOTE: Two copies of this report should be printed. One to include with your deposit and the other to be kept for a 5 year retention within your department.

A copy to Internal Control is no longer required.
Now click Print deposit to finish.
Once your deposit has been tendered and completed at the Cashier’s Office, a receipt will be sent to your designated department e-mail

At times, an employee may give incorrect change to a customer, which may result your deposit to be short or over.

In order to make a correction for a shortage or an overage…
Begin by selecting the deposit you will be making the adjustment for.
Select the “MISC” easy key

and enter your over or short GL account.

If the amount is short enter the shortage amount in both the Item and GL amount fields as a negative number.

Please note that departments are required to enter an explanation as to why the deposit is over or short. Use the references field to enter your explanation.
If the amount is over enter the overage amount in both the Item and GL amount fields.

Ensure that object codes 007Y and 007X have the letter portion capitalized.

CASHNet is case-sensitive and all GL accounts or project codes containing letters must be uppercase.


Please refer to the Business rules validation for GL account document for more information.

Click next to continue.
Click add item after you recorded your overage or shortage.
Print your “CASHNet Deposit Report” as you normally would and include it with your deposit to send to the Cashier and Payment Solutions Office for processing.
Sometimes you may need to find a previously entered deposit. Under the departmental deposit module you may view open, cashiered, or voided deposits within your department.
When you log-in to CASHNet and select Departmental Deposits,
the system will automatically display all open deposits for you or your department, depending on your level of permission.

If you need to view a deposit that has been cashiered, click on the “View Cashiered Deposits from” box and select a date range; the system will default to a one month range.

Be sure to deselect the “View Open Deposits” checkbox to remove those from the criteria.

Click the “Refresh” button to view a new list.

Depending on your level of permissions, you may view all cashiered deposits for your department or only your own.

If you need to view a cashiered deposit, click on the “Select” button

or you may “Print” the detail report.

Depending on your operator permissions, you have access to either view reports within your department or only view deposits you have created.

This feature can be used to generate a detailed report of the deposits that have been created and cashiered and export to file Microsoft Excel, Comma Delimited, Microsoft Word, PDF US Letter, or PDF Unlimited Width.
From the Home Page, select the “Reports” tab located on the top ribbon.
From the Departmental Deposits Report menu select the “Departmental Deposit Detail Report”

This report will automatically generate the following information for deposits completed within a month:

Department Name,

Deposit Number,

Created Operator,

Created Date,

Cashiered Date and Time,

and GL Code.
To export the data, begin by selecting the file type you wish to view the report from the drop down menu.

In this example, we will be saving a report to an Excel file.

Click on “Export to File.”

If you are a PC user:

At the bottom of your screen you will see a pop-up window asking to either open, save, or cancel the file.

or

If you are a Mac user, you will see a dialog box like this one.

Click “Open” to view.
You may also email this file directly from CASHNet by clicking on the “Email” button. A pop-up screen will display, instructing you to enter the intended recipient’s email address.
Click “OK” to send email

You can also customize your reports.

By selecting “Customize”
you can refine your search criteria to include open or voided deposits, only include deposits from specific operators, deposits filtered by a specific amount, etc.

You may make as many changes to any of the criteria below as these changes will not be saved or defaulted the next time you view this report.

Once you have made your changes be sure to select “OK” at the bottom.

If you need help with CASHNet or withe the Kuali Financial System, please drop us an email.

Please click next to close this training.
